item.description: <p>Andres &amp; Co owner Emily Jayne Andres has been fined $48,250 and ordered to pay $51,760 following a NSW Fair Trading investigation to compensate couples who engaged her business for wedding photography between March 2023 and February 2025.</p>

item.title: Government to table laws to combat supermarket price gouging
item.description: <p>Coles reported a profit of $1.08 billion at the end of the 2024-25 financial year, whilst Woolworths had a profit of $1.4 billion.</p>

item.title: Why your social media feeds are being overrun by AI videos
item.description: <p>Social media users around the world may have noticed a surge of AI-generated videos on their feeds in the past few weeks, with an expert warning that this may drive some away from platforms. </p>

item.title: Another two sunscreens pulled from shelves over SPF concerns
item.description: <p>Outside Beauty &amp; Skincare SPF 50+ Mineral Primer and Salus SPF 50+ Daily Facial Sunscreen have been added to a list of recalled sunscreens by the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA).</p>

item.title: Two airport workers killed after cargo plane skids off runway into sea at Hong Kong International Airport
item.description: <p>A cargo aircraft skidded off a Hong Kong runway and collided with a security patrol car before both fell into the sea early today, killing the two people in the car.</p>

item.title: Sussan Ley promises to put future income tax cuts on the table while reducing government spending
item.description: <p>F﻿uture tax cuts will be put on the table by Opposition Leader Sussan Ley as she attempts to guide the Coalition back to government.</p>

item.title: 'Abhorrent': Police hunt machete-wielding gang after attack outside Melbourne's Luna Park
item.description: <p>Two 18-year-olds received minor cuts and a 17-year-old boy was grazed during the incident.</p>

item.title: Child heard woman cry for help before finding her dead, court told
item.description: <p>A young child told police of hearing screams while in bed before waking the next day to find a woman dead on a couch.</p>

item.title: Police issue warning over counterfeit notes handed to NSW businesses
item.description: <p>NSW residents have been warned to be on the look out for counterfeit cash after police seized $2600 in fake notes.</p>

item.title: NSW Police take down artist's mural from station days after it was hung
item.description: <p>A mural erected at Sydney&#x27;s Surry Hills Police Station has been quietly taken down in a matter of days. </p>
